quotes.quote: Never underestimate the effectiveness of a straight cash bribe.
If cash comes with fame, come fame; if cash comes without fame, come cash.
For better or worse, cash is the oxygen of your business, and you can't last long in any environment without it.
In times of crisis, cash is king.
Never underestimate the value of cold cash.
Cash imposes a huge burden. We don't understand it, as it is not immediately visible. It is a huge burden on society.
Either you sit on the pile of cash, or you continue to grow.
Physical money, whether it's checks or cash or credit card, are digitizing in front of us.
CashÂ in must exceedÂ cashÂ out.
Cash-payment is not the sole nexus of man with man.
HoldÂ cashÂ when opportunities are not presenting themselves.
There's nothing wrong withÂ cash. It gives you time to think.
CashÂ combined with courage in a time of crisis is priceless.
CashÂ is the one gift everyone despises and no one turns down.
CashÂ is king. Get every drop ofÂ cashÂ you can get and hold onto it.
Control yourÂ cash. Stick to your core business. Know your numbers.
When bills come due, onlyÂ cashÂ is legal tender. Don't leave home without it.
Never take your eyes off theÂ cashÂ flow because it's the life blood of business.
The only issueÂ cashÂ presents you is the independence of not stressing about funds.
The moreÂ cashÂ that builds up in the treasury, the greater the pressure to piss it away.
There's nothing that will change someone's moral outlook quicker thanÂ cashÂ in large sums.
Havin'Â cashÂ is highly addictive, especially when you're used to havin' money to live with.
Nothing beats a littleÂ cashÂ in a bear market, of course, and the oldest form ofÂ cashÂ is gold.
CashÂ is cold comfort under these circumstances. But make no mistake about it; It is some comfort.
When people talk aboutÂ cashÂ being king, it's not king if it just sits there and never does anything.
CashÂ is always the deciding factor in such matters of moral politics; nothing ever gets done unless motivated by commerce or greed.
If a little does not go, muchÂ cashÂ will not come.
Profits are an opinion,Â cashÂ is a fact.
We wonder, what if we got rid of cash? After all, cash is what keeps terrorists, drug dealers and gun dealers in business.
There's nothing wrong with cash. It gives you time to think.
Cash is the one gift everyone despises and no one turns down.
Cash is very easy to hide. It's easy to hoard. It's easy to move, especially these large bills.
It's a cash and carry world. Sometimes you pay a little. Mostly it's a lot. Sometimes, it's everything you have.
Cash is always the deciding factor in such matters of moral politics; nothing ever gets done unless motivated by commerce or greed.
When you live on cash, you understand the limits of the world around which you navigate each day. Credit leads into a desert with invisible boundaries.
Certainly, it's very easy to fall in love with cash. If you're going to make all your decisions based on cash, you're going to have a pretty naffy career.
People are chasing cash, not happiness. When you chase money, you're going to lose. You're just going to. Even if you get the money, you're not going to be happy.
Control your cash. Stick to your core business. Know your numbers.

When people talk about cash being king, it's not king if it just sits there and never does anything. There are times when cash buys more than other times, and this is one of the other times when it buys a fair amount more, so we use it.
The only issue cash presents you is the independence of not stressing about funds.
